alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued May 20 at 3:10PM MDT until May 21 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...LATE SPRING STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOW TO THE MOUNTAINS, FOOTHILLS, AND FRONT RANGE URBAN CORRIDOR... .Heavy snow will continue to spread south across the mountains and foothills this afternoon and early evening. The heavy snow will accumulate on trees, causing some tree limbs to break and produce scattered power outages. Do not park under trees and avoid walking under snow laden trees. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 10 inches, heaviest amounts near the foothills and southern portions of the Denver metro area. Lighter amounts toward Fort Collins. * WHERE...Fort Collins, Boulder and the western suburbs of Denver, and Denver. * WHEN...Moderate to heavy snow will continue this evening and overnight. Lighter snow is expected Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Heavy snow will accumulate on tree branches and powerlines, possibly causing them to break and leading to power outages. Travel may become slick due to slush accumulation on roadways during periods of heavier snowfall this evening.
info.instruction: Do not touch downed powerlines and report any power outages to your electric company. Consider avoiding travel during the heaviest snow this evening.
